Description: Handle sherd of Corinthian, probably black-figured, pottery globular aryballos; on side: two bands of diagonal parallel strokes separated by pairs of vertical bands; slight remains of decoration on spur connection to mouth; on top: two lines at edge, cross-hatching on handle plate and three concentric lines on mouth; on back, remains consistent with the basck of a female head, as found often on such handles; two lines at edge.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Payne 1931, pl. 31, no. 1. The British Museum sherd consists of the right hand side of an elaborate handle.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.134) (Phase 1)
